com.io7m.jvvfs

Class PathVirtual

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.io7m.jvvfs.PathVirtual
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<PathVirtual>

    public final class PathVirtual
extends Object
implements Comparable<PathVirtual>

    A virtual path represents a path in the virtual filesystem.

    Virtual paths are always absolute.

    The concrete syntax of virtual paths is given by the following EBNF grammar (where name indicates a string representing a valid name): 

     path = "/" , [ name , ("/" , name)* ] ;

    A virtual path is conceptually a list of names, with the empty list representing the root directory.

    See Also:
    Name.isValid(String)

    • Method Detail

      • ofNames

        public static PathVirtual ofNames(List<String> names)
                           throws FilesystemError

        Produce a virtual path from the list of names. The list is assumed to be in the correct order. That is, the path /usr/bin/ps would be represented by the list of names "usr" "bin" "ps", in that order.

        Parameters:
        names - The list of names
        Returns:
        A new virtual path
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If any of the given names are not valid
        See Also:
        Name.isValid(String)

      • ofString

        public static PathVirtual ofString(String path)
                            throws FilesystemError

        Parse the given path according to the EBNF grammar given at the start of this file, and produce a virtual path.

        Parameters:
        path - The path to be parsed
        Returns:
        A new virtual path
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If the given path does not conform to the given grammar (such as being empty, not absolute, or containing a name that is not valid).
        See Also:
        Name.isValid(String)

      • ofStringLax

        public static PathVirtual ofStringLax(String path)
                               throws FilesystemError

        Normalize path by stripping trailing slashes and eliminating multiple consecutive slashes, and then pass the result to ofString(String).

        Parameters:
        path - The path to be parsed
        Returns:
        A new virtual path
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If the path is not valid

        public PathVirtual append(PathVirtual p)

        Append all elements of p to the current path, returning a new path.

        Parameters:
        p - The other path
        Returns:
        The current path with the elements of the other path appended.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(PathVirtual o)

        The ordering relation for virtual paths.

        • If p0.size() < p1.size(), then p0 < p1
        • If p0.size() > p1.size(), then p0 > p1
        • If p0.size() == p1.size(), then:
          • ∃i. p0[i] < p1[i] → p0 < p1
          • ∃i. p0[i] > p1[i] → p0 > p1
          • Otherwise, p0 == p1.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<PathVirtual>
        Parameters:
        o - The other path
        Returns:
        A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this path is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified path.

      • isAncestorOf

        public boolean isAncestorOf(PathVirtual p)

        Determine whether the current path is an ancestor of p.

        p0 is an ancestor of p1 iff: 

         p0 != p1 /\ ∃ p : PathVirtual. p0.append(p) == p1
        Parameters:
        p - The path that may be an ancestor of the current path
        Returns:
        true if the current path is an ancestor of p.

      • isParentOf

        public boolean isParentOf(PathVirtual p)

        Determine whether the current path is the parent of p.

        p0 is the parent of p1 iff: 

         ∃ n : String. p0.appendName(n) == p1
        Parameters:
        p - The path that may be an ancestor of the current path
        Returns:
        true if the current path is the parent of p.

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        Returns:
        true if this path is the root path.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns:
        The number of components in the current path.

      • subtract

        public PathVirtual subtract(PathVirtual other)

        "Subtract" the path other from the current path.

        The subtraction of p1 from p0 is defined as removing the first p1.length elements of p0, if p0 is an ancestor of or is equal to p1.

        Parameters:
        other - The other path
        Returns:
        The current path with other subtracted.
